data.text:
Robert F. Hall Catholic Secondary School Literacy Information for Parents

IF YOU ARE A PARENT OF A GRADE 10 STUDENT YOU NEED TO KNOW THIS…

What You Need to Know about the OSSLT • Grade 10 students will write the OSSLT this year • Literacy happens everywhere – not just in the English classroom • Literacy is a shared responsibility and we need your support

What YOU need to know: • RF Hall will provide a variety of Literacy support programs this year • The following will help explain what resources are available to help you to prepare your son/daughter for the OSSLT

WHAT IS EQAO?(Education Quality Accountability Office) • EQAO is an independent agency established by the government • EQAO creates and implements student assessment

Provides feedback to the Minister of Education and Training, schools and the public based on standardized testing and makes recommendations for improvement. EQAO(Education Quality Accountability Office)

WHAT IS THE OSSLT?(Ontario Secondary School Literacy Test) • Ontario Secondary School Literacy Test (OSSLT) is a standardized literacy test • All grade 10 students in the province of Ontario write this test on Thursday, March, 27, 2014

OSSLT(Ontario Secondary School Literacy Test) • The reading and writing skills tested on the OSSLT are based on all curricula in The Ontario Curriculum up to the end of Grade 9 Students must PASS this test as a GRADUATION requirement!

OSSLT(Ontario Secondary School Literacy Test) • A student will receive a mark of PASS or FAIL • If a student is unsuccessful he/she may re-write the test the following year OR • He/she will be scheduled to take the Ontario Secondary Literacy Course (OSSLC) either during school as a credit course or at summer school or night school

Prior to The Test… • Students will feel more confident and relaxed if they have been preparing by practicing – completing the Literacy activities and listening to feedback from teachers • Check out the EQAO web site: www.eqao.com

How we will prepare your child: • All Grade Ten students will complete practice literacy activities in all of their classes

How we will prepare your child: All Grade 10 students will receive an OSSLT Preparation Workbook with activities related to all of their grade 10 subjects.

How we will prepare your child: • Teachers will provide students with formative assessment feedback on their completed activities

How we will prepare your child: Students having difficulty with the Preparation Workbook will be offered extra help.

How YOU can prepare your child: • Encourage your child to complete the practice activities in their RF Hall Literacy Workbook with their classes • Students falling behind can sign up for the extra literacy support program – call his/her guidance councilor • Practice activities with them at home
